CatDescriptText: Thomas Williams, steelworker, West Mifflin and Barton Baker, steelworker, East Liberty, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, March 26, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think the Federal Government should intervene in the student sit-down demonstrations?"  Mr. Williams' answer reads: "I think the Government should, to prevent violence."  Mr. Baker's answer reads: "Not unless things become worse."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Thomas Williams wearing moustache and fedora with dark band, standing in front of building with tile mosaic; Portrait of Barton Baker wearing plaid hat, eyeglasses, and textured overcoat, standing in front of row of buildings
